SHORT_DESCR.P: The Hampshire De-registration Partnership Register (HDPR) is a bespoke procurement vehicle under the Light Touch Regime open to providers of residential care (excluding residential care for older persons) who are interested in de-registering their home(s) with the Care Quality Commission and transforming them into supported living schemes. The purpose of the HDPR is to facilitate partnership working between the Council and providers in order to ensure the best processes and outcomes for service users, the Council and providers during and after the de-registration process. The HDPR is open to all providers operating in Hampshire who provide residential care services to Hampshire service users. Further details of the background to this procurement and how the bespoke procurement vehicle will operate are available in Document 4 of the procurement documentation available at: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire

MAIN_SITE.P: This opportunity is open to residential care homes operating in Hampshire, excluding the areas covered by Southampton City Council and Portsmouth City Council.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The HDPR is a bespoke procurement vehicle under the Light Touch Regime effectively operating as a hybrid between a traditional Framework and Dynamic Purchasing System. A full description of the HDPR, how it operates, how to apply and how services will be called off is available in Document 4 of the procurement documentation.

The HDPR will remain open for applications for the duration of its lifespan (4+2 years). Application is by way of submitting a completed application form. There will be a temporary closure period between 5.9.2016 and 16.9.2016 for the development of the Master Timeline in conjunction with providers who have submitted applications prior to the closure period. During this time new applications will not be evaluated. The order of call-offs will be determined with reference to the Master Timeline.
The HDPR is open to all providers of residential care (excluding older persons residential care) operating in Hampshire and providing services to Hampshire service users.

INFO_ADD.P: Providers are strongly encouraged to read the procurement documentation to ensure they understand how the HDPR will operate and how to apply should they wish to. In particular, interested providers are strongly encouraged to apply prior to the temporary closure period (5.9.2016 to 16.9.2016) to ensure they are able to participate in the development of the Master Timeline.

RULES_CRITERIA.P: Full details of the criteria applicable to applications is available in the Guidance for Applicants (Document 1).

All applicants must complete a Home Suitability Questionnaire (Document 2, sheet 1) which includes the following assessment areas: Residential Home Details, Property Details, CQC Registration, Safeguarding and Quality History, Service Users and Rates. All questions are Pass/Fail, none are weighted.

1st time applicants must also complete the Basic Information Questionnaire (Document 2, sheet 2) which includes the following assessment areas: Conflicts of Interest, Grounds for Exclusion, Financial Standing, Insurance, Equalities, Health and Safety and Safeguarding. All questions are Pass/Fail, none are weighted.
The Council reserves the right, in its absolute discretion, to amend the criteria from time to time but will endeavour to notify providers where a change is made.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: Details of the measures applicable to monitoring contract performance are available in the Terms of Inclusion (Document 5) at Schedule 1 and the Call-Off Terms and Conditions (Document 6) at Schedule 1.

MAIN_FEATURES_AWARD.P: Full details of the criteria applicable to applications and the procedure for call-offs are available in the Guidance for Applicants (Document 1) and in Document 4. The order in which call-offs will be undertaken will be determined with reference to the Master Timeline. This will be developed in conjunction with providers who have submitted successful applications prior to the temporary closure period (5.9.2016 to 16.9.2016).

INFO_ADD.P: Full details of the invoicing and payment methods applicable to call-off contracts can be found in the Call-Off Terms and Conditions (Document 6) at Schedule 4. The Council employs an electronic care monitoring system which will be applicable to all services called-off under the HDPR and providers will be expected to implement this. Invoicing and payments are managed through this system.
